messages.subject: How to Show Progress
messages.msgSnippet: I wouldn t worry too much about showing progress.  We ve only had one portfolio review so far, but it was with an unschooling friendly person.  The portfolio
messages.messageBody:
I wouldn't worry too much about showing progress. We've only had one
portfolio review so far, but it was with an unschooling friendly person. The
portfolio was just a box full of miscellaneous from the year: literature from any
programs we attended, art work, stories she wrote, a book my daughter had just
finished reading. This year the progress is obvious to me. My daughter went
from a tentative reader to a "just about can read anything" reader. So I'll
mention that to the reviewer, but I won't prepare anything to quantify it.

Regina

<< Date: Fri, 30 May 2003 23:57:29 EDT

From: HMSL2@...

Subject: How to show progress


Any suggestions on showing progress for a review?


What I mean is I have a Portfolio review and I have to "show" progress over

the year.

I had planned on saying/writing down what he has done over the year. I keep

finding myself trying to write this and breaking down what he does in

subjects. Is that what I am expected to do?

Anyone do Portfolios in their state for Unschooling? The person doing this is

Unschool friendly but this is the first Portfolio I have done as we had

tested prior.

>>
